title: Part a. [0–2]
stimulusHtml:
2 points

  • 1 point: correctly labeled graph

  • 1 point: leftward shift of AD, resulting in decrease in real output and decrease in price level
descriptions:
Earns 0 of 2 points

  • 1 point: correctly labeled graph

  • 1 point: leftward shift of AD, resulting in decrease in real output and decrease in price level

Earns 1 of 2 points

  • 1 point: correctly labeled graph

  • 1 point: leftward shift of AD, resulting in decrease in real output and decrease in price level

Earns 2 of 2 points

  • 1 point: correctly labeled graph

  • 1 point: leftward shift of AD, resulting in decrease in real output and decrease in price level

title: Part b. [0–1]
stimulusHtml:
1 point

Employment will decrease because output decreases.
descriptions:
Earns 0 of 1 point.

Employment will decrease because output decreases.

Earns 1 of 1 point.

Employment will decrease because output decreases.

title: Part c. [0–4]
stimulusHtml:
4 points (1 for the policy and 1 for explaining the changes in parts (i), (ii), (iii))

  • 1 point: correct policy — increase G or decrease taxes (T)

  • 1 point: AD increases (shifts to the right) because G increases or T decreases, since both G and C (which increases when T decreases) are components of AD

  • 1 point: output and price level increase because AD increases

  • 1 point: real interest rate increases because government borrowing in the loanable funds market increases the interest rate. Also, the increase in income increases the demand for money, which raises the interest rate.

  • 1 point: real interest rate increases because government borrowing in the loanable funds market increases the interest rate. Also, the increase in income increases the demand for money, which raises the interest rate.

title: Part d. [0–4]
stimulusHtml:
4 points (1 point for the policy and 1 point each for each of the explanations)

  • 1 point: the central bank buys government bonds to increase the money supply

  • 1 point: real interest rate decreases because the money supply increases

  • 1 point: AD increases because investment spending and interest sensitive consumption spending will both increase, and I and C are components of AD

  • 1 point: output and price level will increase because AD has increased

title: Part e. [0–2]
stimulusHtml:
2 points

  • 1 point: inflation rises because of the increase in the money supply

  • 1 point: the value of the domestic currency will decrease because the interest rate is lower and the price level is higher relative to the rest of the world
